nodes.text: Red Three
Red Three was the call sign of the third member of Red Squadron. There were a number of starfighter squadrons with this name, and several pilots went by the call sign Red Three.
History
Galactic Republic
During the recapture of Tythe, Red Three, a member of Red Squadron under the command of Jedi General Obi-Wan Kenobi, was shot down by Separatist forces after entering the planet's atmosphere.
Rebel Alliance

In 1 BBY, Keyan Farlander flew in Red Squadron under the call sign Red Three during a mission to rescue Wookiee slaves. Later that year, another pilot flying under the call sign was killed after failing to rebalance his shields from a missile strike during a mission to protect a disabled X-wing. Farlander returned the call sign in 0 BBY while flying in defense of the MC80 Home One type Star Cruiser Defiance.
The pilot of the disabled X-wing, Biggs Darklighter, would go on to fly as Red Three for a mission to Commenor and in the subsequent Battle of Yavin, where he was killed by Darth Vader.
A pilot under the command of Red Leader Luke Skywalker was assigned the call sign during a mission to Kamino.
During the Attack on Yavin 4, Sarkli was assigned the call sign.[source?]
In his first mission with the Rebel Alliance, Ace Azzameen flew as Red Three.
During the Battle of Endor, Red Three was Sila Kott, a female Human who piloted an A-wing in Red Squadron. She was shot down above a Mon Calamari Star Cruiser by two TIE Interceptors.
New Republic
Wes Janson flew as Red Three in Red Flight under Wedge Antilles at Adumar.
Condor, a member of Red Flight in the 24th Bombardment Squadron, flew with an unnamed pilot under the Red Three call sign during Operation Hammerblow and at the Battle of Doornik-319.
Sith Empire
Red Three was the call sign of an Imperial Navy pilot and member of Red Squadron, a Predator-class fighter squadron of the Imperial Coruscant Third Fleet, during the Battle of Ralltiir.
Behind the scenes
While Rogue pilot Dak Ralter is established to have taken Red Three Biggs Darklighter's place in Red Squadron, it is unknown if he ever used the call sign himself.
